title: Naming Conventions
description: Defines naming standards for code, intent files, schemas, and prompts.

rules.rationale: Aligns naming with the constitutional mandate for JSON as the machine-readable format for intent.
rules.statement: All charter policy files must use snake_case and end with '.json'.

rules.rationale: Allows the validator to deterministically resolve schemas for policy documents.
rules.statement: Schemas for policy files must end with '_policy_schema.json'.

rules.rationale: Differentiates implementation schemas from governance policy schemas.
rules.statement: Schemas for non-policy artifacts must end with '_schema.[json|yaml]'.

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: Schemas for non-policy artifacts must end with '_schema.[json|yaml]'.

rules.rationale: Standardizes the discovery of cognitive templates for AI agents.
rules.statement: All prompt files must use snake_case and end with '.prompt'.

rules.rationale: Identifies change-request artifacts to prevent accidental application without review.
rules.statement: All proposal files must follow the 'cr-*.yaml' naming convention.

rules.rationale: Maintains consistency with Python PEP 8 standards and project conventions.
rules.statement: All Python source files must use snake_case naming.

rules.rationale: Ensures reliable discovery by pytest while preventing the misclassification of test-generation logic or utilities.
rules.statement: All Python test suites (executable tests) MUST be prefixed with 'test_'.
